item.title: Beth add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Beth add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Beth add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Beth add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Beth add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Beth add a quote by Geoffrey Chaucer
item.description: "The lyf so short, the craft so long to lerne." -- Geoffrey Chaucer

item.title: Beth add a quote by Henri Nouwen
item.description: "When we honestly ask ourselves which person in our lives mean the most to us, we often find that it is those who, instead of giving advice, solutions, or cures, have chosen rather to share our pain and touch our wounds with a warm and tender hand. The friend who can be silent with us in a moment of despair or confusion, who can stay with us in an hour of grief and bereavement, who can tolerate not knowing, not curing, not healing and face with us the reality of our powerlessness, that is a friend who cares." -- Henri Nouwen

item.title: Beth add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description:
"Quand tu veux construire un bateau, ne commence pas par rassembler du bois, couper des planches et distribuer du travail, mais reveille au sein des hommes le desir de la mer grande et large.
If you want to build a ship, don't drum up people together to collect wood and don't assign them tasks and work, but rather teach them to long for the endless immensity of the sea." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Beth add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Beth add a quote by Chuang Tzu
item.description: "The sound of water says what I think." -- Chuang Tzu

item.title: Beth add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "The highest function of love is that it makes the loved one a unique and irreplaceable being." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Beth add a quote by Jonathan Carroll
item.description: "One of the saddest realities is that we never know when our lives are at their peak. Only after it is over and we have some kind of perspective do we realize how good we had it a day, a month, five years ago. " -- Jonathan Carroll

item.title: Beth add a quote by Jonathan Carroll
item.description: "You have to walk carefully in the beginning of love; the running across fields into your lover's arms can only come later when you're sure they won't laugh if you trip." -- Jonathan Carroll

item.title: Beth add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I want To do with you what spring does with the cherry trees." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Beth add a quote by Alfred Tennyson
item.description: "I am a part of all that I have met." -- Alfred Tennyson

item.title: Beth add a quote by Dale Carnegie
item.description: "It isn't what you have or who you are or where you are or what you are doing that makes you happy or unhappy. It is what you think about it." -- Dale Carnegie

item.title: Beth add a quote by Paramahansa Yogananda
item.description: "Be as simple as you can be; you will be astonished to see how uncomplicated and happy your life can become." -- Paramahansa Yogananda

item.title: Beth add a quote by Marianne Williamson
item.description: "There is, inside all our heads, the ego’s rabid attack dog. It is purely vicious toward others and toward ourselves as well. Learning to control that dog, and ultimately to end its life, is the process and purpose of enlightened relationships." -- Marianne Williamson

item.title: Beth add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "What's past is prologue." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Beth add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "When you're unhappy, you get to pay a lot of attention to yourself. And you get to take yourself oh so very seriously. Your truly happy people, which is to say, your people who truly like themselves, they don't think about themselves very much. Your unhappy person resents it when you try to cheer him up, because that means he has to stop dwellin' on himself and start payin' attention to the universe. Unhappiness is the ultimate form of self-indulgence." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Beth add a quote by Amit Goswami
item.description: "It is not just do do do. It is not just be be be. It is do be do be do." -- Amit Goswami

item.title: Beth add a quote by Iyanla Vanzant
item.description: "God is love. Love is always present, surrounding us; guiding, growing, and teaching us. Even in the midst of total chaos, pain, and dysfunction, love is calling us to a higher experience and expression." -- Iyanla Vanzant

item.title: Beth add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "Pan, who and what art thou?" he cried huskily. "I'm youth, I'm joy," Peter answered at a venture, "I'm a little bird that has broken out of the egg." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Beth add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Beth add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Beth add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "I'm a very ordinary human being; I just happen to like reading books." -- Haruki Murakami
